Author: copilot-pull-request-reviewer
BodySnippet: The condition `!variables` is insufficient to determine if a variables object exists. An empty object `{}` is truthy but has no meaningful variables. This could allow unsafe query strings with empty variables objects. Use `!hasSeasonVariable` or check `Object.keys(variables).length === 0` instead.

Author: copilot-pull-request-reviewer
BodySnippet:
Use `Number.isFinite()` instead of global `isFinite()` for type-safe checking. The global `isFinite()` coerces values to numbers which can hide bugs. 
```suggestion 
  if (typeof g.leverage === 'number' && Number.isFinite(g.leverage)) { 
```

Author: copilot-pull-request-reviewer
BodySnippet:
Converting SecureString to plain text using `PtrToStringAuto` leaves the token in unmanaged memory. Use `PtrToStringUni` with explicit `ZeroFreeBSTR` cleanup to securely clear the unmanaged memory after use. 
```suggestion 
  $bstr = [Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($secureToken) 
  try {
